Reference ID: 35529

Interprets and applies data analytics to provide recommendations to the business.
ACCOUNTABILITIES
Develops and executes statistical and mathematical solutions to business problems
Frame problem, determine intended approach and recommend quantitative methods to develop solution
Use analytical rigor and statistical methods to analyze large amounts of data, culling actionable insights using advanced statistical techniques such as predictive statistical models, customer profiling, segmentation analysis, survey design and analysis and data mining
Design experiments to answer targeted questions
Document projects including business objective, data gathering and processing, leading approaches, final algorithm, detailed set of results and analytical metrics
Develops materials to explain project findings to management
Develops new algorithms and mathematical approaches to understand Kohl's audiences and solves complex business problems such as optimizing product performance, revenue and adoption
Identify and drive continuous improvement of key business metrics in assigned business functional area
Drive adoption and usage of analytical products and models
Think in terms of iterative development, document, and communicate throughout products data science lifecycle
Build and validate models
QUALIFICATIONS
Experience developing custom models based on in-depth understanding of underlying data, data structures, and business problems to ensure analytics deliverables meet stakeholders need
Experience developing state of the art algorithms using machine learning, statistical and optimization methods to power various aspects of highly complex business models
Experience using modern analytics tools and languages such as Python, R, Spark, SQL (BigQuery), etc
Experience proposing rapid experiments to test the effect of new strategies or initiatives, and iterate quickly
REQUIRED
2+ years of progressively complex Data Science or analytics experience
BS in Data Science, Computer Science, Machine Learning, Applied Mathematics, or equivalent quantitative field
Spark, Python, R proficiency
PREFERRED
Masters degree
Retail experience
Supply chain management
Marketing models
Logistics experience

Department Summary

Television is at an inflection point. This is your chance to be a part of a team that is transforming entertainment by changing the perception of what television is and how it can be enjoyed. Driven by the broad appeal of being able to watch live sports, movies, and shows anywhere, anytime, Sling TV is the first provider of live television over the internet to multiple devices in your home or outside. We changed the entire industry on how live TV is consumed and we are starting on a second revolution to bring the best of media consumption (live TV and On Demand) to consumers.

We are driven by curiosity, pride, adventure, and a desire to win - it's in our DNA. We're looking for people with boundless energy, intelligence, and an overwhelming need-to-achieve to join our team as we embark on the next chapter of our story.

Job Duties and Responsibilities

The Role

We are seeking a curious, energetic and passionate individual to join our Analytics Team as a Business Intelligence Analyst. This individual should have strong technical skills and excellent communication skills. The Business Intelligence team is responsible for sharing key insights with all levels of the organization, so it requires the ability to tell the story behind our data. This role requires attention to detail, critical thinking, and creative problem solving.

The Responsibilities
Develop, implement, and maintain automated reports on key results and performance metrics to support and improve business decisions
Utilize multiple data systems and visualization tools to connect and share data
Work closely with many different business partners including department managers, executives, IT, and Data Governance teams to understand business needs, gather requirements, develop and document processes, and ensure necessary data and insights are available and easy to consume
Perform ad hoc analyses and modeling as needed

Skills, Experience and Requirements

Minimum required skills / experience:
Experience with SQL, cleaning, prepping, and analyzing large data sets;
Experience with data visualization and common tools (Tableau, Power BI, etc.);
Strong communication skills and presentation skills;
Commitment to teamwork;
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment.


Desired skills / experience:
Master's or advanced degree in Data Science/Analytics or 6+ years relevant work experience;
Excellent SQL skills;
Excellent Tableau skills;
Experience with AWS data systems, EC2, GitHub;
Intellectual curiosity, attention to detail, and strong personal initiative.

Salary Range

Compensation: $87,500.00/Year - $125,000.00/Year
Benefits

From versatile health perks to new career opportunities, check out our benefits on our careers website .

The world isn’t standing still, and neither is Allstate. We’re moving quickly, looking across our businesses and brands and taking bold steps to better serve customers’ evolving needs. That’s why now is an exciting time to join our team. You’ll have opportunities to take risks, challenge the status quo and shape the future for the greater good.
You’ll do all this in an environment of excellence and the highest ethical standards – a place where values such as integrity, inclusive diversity and accountability are paramount. We empower every employee to lead, drive change and give back where they work and live. Our people are our greatest strength, and we work as one team in service of our customers and communities. Plus, Allstate is changing how, when, and where we work-to lead us boldly into our future. We're empowering our employees to create better ways of working through more intentional use of communication and collaboration practices, processes and tools.
Everything we do at Allstate is driven by a shared purpose: to protect people from life’s uncertainties so they can realize their hopes and dreams. For more than 89 years we’ve thrived by staying a step ahead of whatever’s coming next – to give customers peace of mind no matter what changes they face. We acted with conviction to advocate for seat belts, air bags and graduated driving laws. We help give survivors of domestic violence a voice through financial empowerment. We’ve been an industry leader in pricing sophistication, telematics, digital photo claims and, more recently, device and identity protection. We are the Good Hands. We don’t follow the trends. We set them. Job Summary:
Allstate is seeking an outstanding Data Scientist to develop models that uncover key marketing insights and deliver exceptional value.
As the marketing landscape continues to evolve, we need to build and develop the right solutions to improve marketing spend and effectiveness and enhance our customer acquisition sophistication across the organization.
As a data scientist on the Marketing Analytics & Data Science team, you will have the opportunity to influence the long-term evolution of our marketing capabilities by building and evolving innovative models and analyses.
Your work will help Allstate deliver simple, affordable, and connected protection that will help customers achieve their hopes and dreams. Key Responsibilities:
Support the analytical needs of the Allstate marketing team inclusive of routine reporting, statistical inference, and predictive modeling
Improve marketing spend and effectiveness
Enhance customer acquisition sophistication
Analysis of complex datasets to make decisions, find patterns, and drive data insights for scaling Allstate’s marketing initiatives
Ensure the quality and timeliness of analytic deliverables
Develop and present insights and recommendations to senior management audiences
Collaborate with marketing data engineers to implement predictive models About the Team
We are collaborative
We are innovative
We are learners
We are accountable Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree and 2+ years of experience -OR- Master’s Degree
Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Economics, Statistics, Applied Math, Computer Science, or related field
2+ years of experience with SQL
2+ years of experience with data science languages (e.g. Python, R, Julia, etc.)
Strong verbal/written communication & data presentation skills, including an ability to effectively communicate with both business and technical teams. Preferred Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree with 2+ years of experience OR Master’s Degree and 1+ years of experience OR PhD
Advanced degree in Engineering, Economics, Statistics, Applied Math, Computer Science, or related field
Track record for executing independent projects and leading complex, multi-functional projects with several dependencies
Knowledge and practical experience implementing into production at least one of the following:
Machine learning models (XGBoost, GBM, LASSO, neural networks, etc)
Time series modelling
Bayesian modeling (MCMC, Gibbs sampling, Metropolis-Hastings, etc)
Reinforcement learning
Recommendation systems
Multi-arm bandits
Optimization
Experimental design
A/B/n testing
Causal inference
Quasi-experimental analysis Compensation Data

JOB SUMMARY: Responsible for conducting advanced analysis of marketing campaigns from both structured and unstructured data to better understand marketing opportunities. Design, develop and evaluate advanced predictive and machine learning models with a focus on the optimization of marketing tactics and the guest journey within campaigns, products and events. Help refine media and owned tactics by using a variety of techniques, ranging from statistical analysis to complex data mining and modeling. Conduct advanced analysis on various marketing efforts to gauge performance, impact and effectiveness against the desired results. Deliver clear and compelling findings with data visualization tools and presentations that inform and inspire internal stakeholders to make better business decisions. Collaborate with colleagues in Marketing Operations and IT to infuse predictive analytics into customer touchpoints, driving increased relevance and business performance.
MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES:
Serve as a subject matter expert on developing and maintaining marketing mix attribution models for ongoing measurement of the incremental value of marketing efforts. Leverage forecasting and simulation-based modeling approaches to provide optimization recommendations of marketing plans.
Engage with internal partners to translate business problems into a framework for advanced analysis and collaborate to establish project goals and deliverables.
Define and produce deliverables that identify opportunities to tracking and measurement plans that inform and inspire internal stakeholders and decision makers.
Understands and actively participates in Environmental, Health & Safety responsibilities by following established UO policy, procedures, training and team member involvement activities.
Performs other duties as assigned.
EDUCATION: Advanced degree (M.S., or M.A., or Ph.D.) in relevant quantitative field (e.g., economics, econometrics, computer science, mathematics, engineering, statistics, data science, business analytics) required.
EXPERIENCE: 5+ years of prior hands-on experience in data science is preferred; or equivalent combination of education and experience. Competency in programming with statistical modeling tools to fuel and deliver marketing personalization and business insights. Strong familiarity with manipulating and mining data to transform business decisions that impact the bottom line. Knowledgeable in leveraging visual analytics to create a seamless and inspirational story that inspire and inform business leaders with the necessary knowledge to drive revenue and customer loyalty.
Experience/Knowledge in the following areas preferred:
Travel & Resort Industry, Entertainment &/or Theme Park experience
Marketing Personalization
Marketing Mix Models, attribution, forecasting, and market testing
Digital Marketing & Analytics
Business Intelligence Reporting
CRM Execution
Consumer Research and Journey
Consumer Data
Competitive Analysis

Job Name: Junior Data Scientist - Experimental Design (Remote - Home Based Worker)
Job Description:
The world isn’t standing still, and neither is Allstate. We’re moving quickly, looking across our businesses and brands and taking bold steps to better serve customers’ evolving needs. That’s why now is an exciting time to join our team. You’ll have opportunities to take risks, challenge the status quo and shape the future for the greater good.

You’ll do all this in an environment of excellence and the highest ethical standards – a place where values such as integrity, inclusive diversity and accountability are paramount. We empower every employee to lead, drive change and give back where they work and live. Our people are our greatest strength, and we work as one team in service of our customers and communities.

Everything we do at Allstate is driven by a shared purpose: to protect people from life’s uncertainties so they can realize their hopes and dreams. For more than 89 years we’ve thrived by staying a step ahead of whatever’s coming next – to give customers peace of mind no matter what changes they face. We acted with conviction to advocate for seat belts, air bags and graduated driving laws. We help give survivors of domestic violence a voice through financial empowerment. We’ve been an industry leader in pricing sophistication, telematics, digital photo claims and, more recently, device and identity protection. We are the Good Hands. We don’t follow the trends. We set them. Department Summary:
Data, Discovery, and Decision Science (D3) is the research and analytics organization at Allstate. In D3, you’ll be surrounded by 360+ tenacious and intellectually curious colleagues in an inclusive culture that encourages you to take risks, challenge the status quo and shape the future for the greater good. We are solving some of today’s most complicated analytics problems, making the lives of our Allstate colleagues easier and more productive, and driving our mission to deliver targeted insurance solutions to our customers. We are partnering to incorporate analytics into every aspect of the enterprise. We are avid about learning new ways to get the most value from our massive data resources and leading-edge technology. We are committed to building an inclusive and diverse team where everyone has an equal opportunity to succeed. We strive to hire people from different backgrounds so that we can better serve our diverse customer needs. Job Summary:
In this role, you will serve as a consultant in the design and analysis of experiments with partners across the enterprise. You will collaborate as part of cross-functional teams on a wide variety of strategic initiatives and your contributions will inform learning and evidence-based decision making within these programs. You will be responsible for advising throughout the lifecycle of a program and supporting success through technical execution (i.e. evaluating potential design approaches, sample size and test duration calculations) and analysis (communication of results and messaging of statistical concepts to influence action).

This role is posted at the junior, entry level; however, D3 hiring leadership has flexibility to hire at a more senior level if your background includes directly-applicable years of experience and competencies. For this reason, we'd invite both entry-level and experienced Data Scientists to apply. Key Responsibilities:
Uses best practices, with coaching, to develop statistical and machine learning techniques to build experimental designs and models that address business needs and enable test and learn competency.
Understands business problems and constraints to identify the optimal learning approach.
Communicates to team members, leadership and stakeholders on findings to ensure test results are well understood and incorporated into business processes.
Collaborates with the team on data and business problems to drive improved business results through designing, building, and partnering to implement tests and analytic solutions.
Innovates on projects by using new techniques or tools Qualifications:
Education and Experience
Master’s or PhD
2 or more years of related experience (To be considered for the more senior-level version of this role)

Functional Skills
Experience in using statistical modeling and/or test & learn techniques to design solutions that have informed and influenced company decision making
Ability to provide written and oral interpretation of highly specialized terms and data, and ability to present this data to others with different levels of expertise
Demonstrated Analytic Agility and ability to quickly learn and switch topics
Ability to use and learn a wide variety of tools and languages to achieve results
Ability to code and develop prototypes in various languages
Ability to analyze and interpret moderate concepts (especially in the context of statistics and design of experiments)

Compensation offered for this role is $80,000 - $94,000 and is based on experience and qualifications.

The candidate(s) offered this position will be required to submit to a background investigation, which includes a drug screen.

The Civilian Business Unit of SAIC is seeking a highly qualified Lead Data Scientist to support the U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services contact in the Washington DC Metropolitan area. The position will work closely with the government technical leadership, customer organizations and the SAIC Program Manager. The duties will include interfacing with the customer organizations at all levels from Division Chiefs to Analysts; developing and presenting reports; developing and meeting data science requirements.
This position can be worked 100% remote nationwide.
Duties and Responsibilities:
Translates mission needs into an end-to-end analytical approach to achieve results
Present solutions and recommendations to client leadership
Determines the appropriate analytics based on the data and the desired outcomes, using techniques including feature detection, statistics, data mining, predictive modeling, machine learning, natural language processing, and business intelligence. Interprets the validity of results and communicates the meaning of those results. Has familiarity with data wrangling, analytics, and visualization software and programming languages, including analytics methods for big data.
Follows a scientific approach to generate value from data, verifying results at each step.

Study appropriate datasets and transform data science prototypes
Research and implement appropriate machine learning algorithms and tools and develop machine learning applications according to requirements
Train systems when necessary

Bachelors and fifteen (15) years or more experience; Masters and thirteen (13) years or more experience; PhD or JD and four (4) years or more experience
U.S. Citizenship is required and ability to obtain DHS Suitability Clearance
Expertise fostering innovative Big Data and Advanced Analytics solutions.
Be able to support Transformation leadership in data and analytics vision and identify, establish, and deliver innovative Advanced Analytics and Machine Learning solutions
Experience with developing predictive models for using large data sets for high transactional volume environment
Experience with evaluating and measuring performance of models
Should have a firm understanding of common statistical modeling and techniques (e.g., linear regression, decision trees).
Demonstrate excellent troubleshooting skills.
Possess the ability to perform with little direct supervision as a self-starter.
Be a self-motivated, creative, and inquisitive problem solver with a strong work ethic.
Be (or rapidly become) a thought-leader in the area of analytics/data science with respect to entity resolution as it pertains to the customer's mission.
Experience with DataBricks

Northrop Grumman’s Space Systems is looking for Associate/ Reliability Engineer/Data Scientist to join our team at the (Promontory/Bacchus) UT, Facility.
Description & Responsibilities:
This position provides data science and reliability analysis support on Northrop Grumman rocket motor programs including the USAF Minuteman missile, the US Navy Trident (D5) missile, as well as developing rocket motors such as CBS, Hypersonics, Castor and GEM motor programs. This position supports other Propulsion Systems organizations outside of Science and Engineering, (Operations, Business Development, Information Technologies, Quality, etc.) with statistical and reliability analyses.
A Data Scientist/Reliability Analyst provides analysis and support on many programs and varied data types. Opportunities vary widely across many applications of statistics and data science needs as well as using statistical methods to predict reliability measures for rocket and missile programs. There are also opportunities to present findings and predictions to design reviews where rocket and missile designs are reviewed and evaluated by the customer. This position may be located at either the Promontory or Bacchus facilities.
Job Duties:
Analyze and interpret data from various performance tests on rocket motor systems.
Provide support for reliability predictions on Hypersonics and other programs as needed.
Support data mining and statistical modeling needs for prediction of aging effects on systems.
Prepare and present reliability allocations and predictions at technical interchange and design review meetings.
Provide consulting support for process control measures on ingredients and material properties data.
Make reliability assessments of engineering changes and signoff on those changes.
Support regular reliability reporting and predictions on the Trident II (D5) missile program.
Experience Requirements:
Candidate must have a minimum of 0-3 years of experience in statistics, data science, or other industrial mathematics.
Ability to travel: Travel expectation of up to 10%
Experience with probability or reliability calculations and topics is a plus
Excellent written and oral communication skills is required
Self-directed and self-motivated. Strong team player.
Writing, documentation and presentation experience
Skills
Strong skills in MS Word, PowerPoint, Excel
Technical software knowledge or experience with R & Rstudio, JMP, Statistica, or other statistics software
Ability to learn how to apply statistics and data science to other fields of science
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Excellent time management and organizational skills
Competencies for Success:
Experience or background in applied statistics and/or reliability analysis
Experience and/or background in failure modes and design for reliability
Computer applications programming and/or administration
Education/Requirements:
BS degree in Engineering, Statistics, Data Science or other quantitative field (Mathematics, Industrial Math, Reliability Engineering) with 0 years’ experience with a BS degree
Position can be filled one level higher, 2 years with a BS or 0 years’ experience with MS
UTspace

The physical location of this position will be in McLean, VA.
Are you passionate about the chance to bring your data quality improvement experience to a world class organization that is leading the way in both content and technology to serve and protect our citizens home and abroad? Do you have the skills necessary to manage, understand, and analyze in-house and customer data including text mining, developing predictive systems, risk scoring, creating efficient algorithms, data quality improvement and other related activities? Then Thomson Reuters Special Services (TRSS) is looking for you!
What You’ll Do: As a Data Scientist, you will be responsible for driving, identify, evaluate, design and implement statistical analyses of gathered open source, proprietary, and customer data to create analytic metrics and tools to support TRSS analysts, customers and existing product offerings. Successful candidates will have the opportunity to contribute directly to the features and capabilities deployed in our applications. They will work with customers to assist in gathering requirements and contributing to Statements of Work (SOWs) for new sales or POCs, and executing design post sale while getting deeply involved into the delivery of the proposed solutions. The role will interface with the customer and provide continuity of technical and data-exploration expertise to ensure we are delivering a workable solution that meets the customer requirements and technical capabilities. The position requires a proactive, mission-oriented person who strives to produce the best possible work for the customer.
As the Data Scientist, you will also contribute to a variety of areas including:
Working with interdisciplinary engineering and research teams on designing, building and deploying data analysis systems for large data sets.
Working closely with customers to apply data science to their mission specific content.
Creating algorithms to extract information from large data sets.
Establishment of scalable, efficient, automated processes for model development, model validation, model implementation, and large-scale data analysis.
Development of metrics and prototypes that can be used to drive business decisions.
Providing thought-leadership and dependable execution on diverse projects.
Identification of emergent trends and opportunities for future client growth and development.
Researching and identifying Artificial Intelligence (AI) methods – including Machine Learning (ML) and Natural Language Processing (NLP) methods.
Identification of new applications of AI in the context of Thomson Reuters and TRSS content sets.
Exploring existing data for insights, and recommends additional sources of data for improvement.
About You:
You’re a good fit for the role of Data Scientist if you have:
A minimum of DHS granted public trust suitablity, DOD Secret or Top Secret required.
A Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field (e.g., statistics, computer science, mathematics, physical/biological sciences, or GIS).
Three years of experience with data cleaning, analysis, programming, and reporting of results to internal or external stakeholders.
Programming skills in one major programming language (Python/R/Java).
Are creative, intellectually curious, and willing to experiment and work in dynamic organizations and situations, sometimes with little oversight or well-defined requirements.
The ability to take ownership for defined areas of accountability, most critically the integrity of the technical and data design in terms of meeting customer needs, design delivery and supportability.
A good understanding of distributed computing concepts.
Experience facilitating and gathering input from subject matter experts.
Excellent understanding of ML, NLP, and statistical methodologies.
The ability to test ideas and adapt methods quickly end to end from data extraction to implementation and validation.
Strong planning, time management, and organizational skills.
A team player / self-starter mentality with the ability to work using own initiative.
Ability to obtain and maintain a U.S. national security clearance.
Additional Desired Skills:
Big Data analytics experience (preferred, but not required).
Previous experience with data modeling for graphs (preferred, but not required).
Experience with search engines, classification algorithms, recommendation systems, and relevance evaluation methodologies (preferred, but not required).
What’s in it For You?

Our Culture: Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more

At Thomson Reuters, we’ve been doing just that for almost 160 years. Our industry-leading products and services include highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for legal, tax, accounting and compliance professionals combined with the world’s most global news services – Reuters. We help these professionals do their jobs better, creating more time for them to focus on the things that matter most: advising, advocating, negotiating, governing and informing.
We are powered by the talents of 25,000 employees across more than 75 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in flexible work environments that celebrate diversity and inclusion. Job Name: Principal Data Scientist - Deep Learning (Remote - Home Based Worker)
Job Description:
The world isn’t standing still, and neither is Allstate. We’re moving quickly, looking across our businesses and brands and taking bold steps to better serve customers’ evolving needs. That’s why now is an exciting time to join our team. You’ll have opportunities to take risks, challenge the status quo and shape the future for the greater good.
You’ll do all this in an environment of excellence and the highest ethical standards – a place where values such as integrity, inclusive diversity and accountability are paramount. We empower every employee to lead, drive change and give back where they work and live. Our people are our greatest strength, and we work as one team in service of our customers and communities. Plus, Allstate is changing how, when, and where we work-to lead us boldly into our future. We're empowering our employees to create better ways of working through more intentional use of communication and collaboration practices, processes and tools.
Everything we do at Allstate is driven by a shared purpose: to protect people from life’s uncertainties so they can realize their hopes and dreams. For more than 89 years we’ve thrived by staying a step ahead of whatever’s coming next – to give customers peace of mind no matter what changes they face. We acted with conviction to advocate for seat belts, air bags and graduated driving laws. We help give survivors of domestic violence a voice through financial empowerment. We’ve been an industry leader in pricing sophistication, telematics, digital photo claims and, more recently, device and identity protection. We are the Good Hands. We don’t follow the trends. We set them. Job Summary
Data, Discovery, and Decision Science (D3) is the research and analytics organization at Allstate. In D3, you’ll be surrounded by 330+ tenacious and intellectually curious colleagues in an inclusive culture that encourages you to take risks, challenge the status quo and shape the future for the greater good. We are solving some of today’s most complicated analytics problems, making the lives of our Allstate colleagues easier and more productive, and driving our mission to deliver targeted insurance solutions to our customers. We are partnering to incorporate analytics into every aspect of the enterprise. We are avid about learning new ways to get the most value from our massive data resources and leading-edge technology. We are committed to creating an inclusive and diverse work environment where everyone has an equal opportunity to succeed. We strive to hire people from a wide variety of backgrounds so that we can better serve our increasingly diverse and multi-faceted customer base. Developing ourselves and others is key to our success.

D3’s Data Science Team is a key business partner to the Claims organization, supporting their leaders and end-users by developing solutions that will deliver the most advanced claim experience on the planet. We leverage data, technology, analytic capabilities, and business relationships to develop solutions to drive outstanding quality, effortless customer service and operational excellence. We are equally passionate about how our solutions benefit Allstate customers and claim professionals. By leveraging top talent from various quantitative disciplines, we collaborate with business partners and software engineers in development teams to create innovative products fueled by data science, artificial intelligence and industry insights.

Allstate’s goal is to use computer vision on photos/video and natural language processing of customer calls and sensor data from cars/homes to revolutionize how claims are handled. To go through this transformation, we require models that can extract meaning from the large amount of unstructured data customers supply us with for each claim. Below are a few examples of how we are using deep learning today:

NLP to predict who is at fault for an auto accident based on call recordings/transcripts of the accident. Knowing who is at fault allows for Allstate to pay our customers quickly.
Computer vision to identify the point of impact on a vehicle. Knowing the point of impact is critical for predicting if someone is injured in the vehicle or how much the vehicle is worth after the accident.
Computer vision to determine how to best repair damage to a vehicle.
NLP to extract information from a call. The question-and-answer pattern of our claim reporting system has many drop-down menus. This makes it easy to file a claim but isn’t always optimal for describing the nuances of each accident. By extracting extra meaning from the calls with NLP, we can get rich information out of the call for automation.

We are looking for someone who has deep expertise in computer vision or natural language processing who can take our deep learning to the next level.
Key Responsibilities

In this role, you will:
Identify new areas for deep learning that are not currently being worked on.
Research methods to improve modeling, including new techniques, data sources, and features.
Balance research of new techniques with execution and delivery of prioritized projects.
Work collaboratively and transparently with teammates to create a strong team culture.
Proactively support the team in ideation of how to approach a problem and reviewing results of model building.
Share modeling progress and results with our business partners to build excitement and enthusiasm for our work.
This role is for someone with lots of deep learning experience. This person will help expand the teams theoretical understanding of deep learning.

Supervisory Responsibilities:
This job has no supervisory duties. However, you will be expected to mentor junior data scientists on the team. Preferred Qualifications
PhD involving research in Computer Vision or Natural Language Processing
Preferred: 4+ years experience applying Computer Vision or Natural Language Processing to solve business problems. Compensation Data
The compensation range for this position is $147,000 and $190,000 per year, based on experience and qualifications.
The candidate(s) offered this position will be required to submit to a background investigation, which includes a drug screen.

Good Work. Good Life. Good Hands®.

As a Fortune 100 company and industry leader, we provide a competitive salary – but that’s just the beginning. Our Total Rewards package also offers benefits like tuition assistance, medical and dental insurance, as well as a robust pension and 401(k). Plus, you’ll have access to a wide variety of programs to help you balance your work and personal life -- including a generous paid time off policy. For a full description of Allstate’s benefits, visit allstate.jobs/benefits

Learn more about life at Allstate. Connect with us on Twitter , Facebook , Instagram and LinkedIn or watch a video .

Everything we do at Allstate is driven by a shared purpose: to protect people from life’s uncertainties so they can realize their hopes and dreams. For more than 89 years we’ve thrived by staying a step ahead of whatever’s coming next – to give customers peace of mind no matter what changes they face. We acted with conviction to advocate for seat belts, air bags and graduated driving laws. We help give survivors of domestic violence a voice through financial empowerment. We’ve been an industry leader in pricing sophistication, telematics, digital photo claims and, more recently, device and identity protection. We are the Good Hands. We don’t follow the trends. We set them. Department Summary:
Data, Discovery, and Decision Science (D3) is the research and analytics organization at Allstate. In D3, you’ll be surrounded by 360+ tenacious and intellectually curious colleagues in an inclusive culture that encourages you to take risks, challenge the status quo and shape the future for the greater good. We are solving some of today’s most complicated analytics problems, making the lives of our Allstate colleagues easier and more productive, and driving our mission to deliver targeted insurance solutions to our customers. We are partnering to incorporate analytics into every aspect of the enterprise. We are avid about learning new ways to get the most value from our massive data resources and leading-edge technology. We are committed to building an inclusive and diverse team where everyone has an equal opportunity to succeed. We strive to hire people from different backgrounds so that we can better serve our diverse customer needs. Job Summary:
In this role, you will serve as a consultant in the design and analysis of experiments with partners across the enterprise. You will collaborate as part of cross-functional teams on a wide variety of strategic initiatives and your contributions will inform learning and evidence-based decision making within these programs. You will be responsible for advising throughout the lifecycle of a program and supporting success through technical execution (i.e. evaluating potential design approaches, sample size and test duration calculations) and analysis (communication of results and messaging of statistical concepts to influence action).

This role is posted at the junior, entry level; however, D3 hiring leadership has flexibility to hire at a more senior level if your background includes directly-applicable years of experience and competencies. For this reason, we'd invite both entry-level and experienced Data Scientists to apply. Key Responsibilities:
Uses best practices, with coaching, to develop statistical and machine learning techniques to build experimental designs and models that address business needs and enable test and learn competency.
Understands business problems and constraints to identify the optimal learning approach.
Communicates to team members, leadership and stakeholders on findings to ensure test results are well understood and incorporated into business processes.
Collaborates with the team on data and business problems to drive improved business results through designing, building, and partnering to implement tests and analytic solutions.
Innovates on projects by using new techniques or tools Qualifications:
Education and Experience
Master’s or PhD
2 or more years of related experience (To be considered for the more senior-level version of this role)

Functional Skills
Experience in using statistical modeling and/or test & learn techniques to design solutions that have informed and influenced company decision making
Ability to provide written and oral interpretation of highly specialized terms and data, and ability to present this data to others with different levels of expertise
Demonstrated Analytic Agility and ability to quickly learn and switch topics
Ability to use and learn a wide variety of tools and languages to achieve results
Ability to code and develop prototypes in various languages
Ability to analyze and interpret moderate concepts (especially in the context of statistics and design of experiments)

Compensation offered for this role is $80,000 - $94,000 and is based on experience and qualifications.

The candidate(s) offered this position will be required to submit to a background investigation, which includes a drug screen.

Job Name: Principal Data Scientist - Deep Learning (Remote - Home Based Worker)
Job Description:
The world isn’t standing still, and neither is Allstate. We’re moving quickly, looking across our businesses and brands and taking bold steps to better serve customers’ evolving needs. That’s why now is an exciting time to join our team. You’ll have opportunities to take risks, challenge the status quo and shape the future for the greater good.
You’ll do all this in an environment of excellence and the highest ethical standards – a place where values such as integrity, inclusive diversity and accountability are paramount. We empower every employee to lead, drive change and give back where they work and live. Our people are our greatest strength, and we work as one team in service of our customers and communities. Plus, Allstate is changing how, when, and where we work-to lead us boldly into our future. We're empowering our employees to create better ways of working through more intentional use of communication and collaboration practices, processes and tools.
Everything we do at Allstate is driven by a shared purpose: to protect people from life’s uncertainties so they can realize their hopes and dreams. For more than 89 years we’ve thrived by staying a step ahead of whatever’s coming next – to give customers peace of mind no matter what changes they face. We acted with conviction to advocate for seat belts, air bags and graduated driving laws. We help give survivors of domestic violence a voice through financial empowerment. We’ve been an industry leader in pricing sophistication, telematics, digital photo claims and, more recently, device and identity protection. We are the Good Hands. We don’t follow the trends. We set them. Job Summary
Data, Discovery, and Decision Science (D3) is the research and analytics organization at Allstate. In D3, you’ll be surrounded by 330+ tenacious and intellectually curious colleagues in an inclusive culture that encourages you to take risks, challenge the status quo and shape the future for the greater good. We are solving some of today’s most complicated analytics problems, making the lives of our Allstate colleagues easier and more productive, and driving our mission to deliver targeted insurance solutions to our customers. We are partnering to incorporate analytics into every aspect of the enterprise. We are avid about learning new ways to get the most value from our massive data resources and leading-edge technology. We are committed to creating an inclusive and diverse work environment where everyone has an equal opportunity to succeed. We strive to hire people from a wide variety of backgrounds so that we can better serve our increasingly diverse and multi-faceted customer base. Developing ourselves and others is key to our success.

D3’s Data Science Team is a key business partner to the Claims organization, supporting their leaders and end-users by developing solutions that will deliver the most advanced claim experience on the planet. We leverage data, technology, analytic capabilities, and business relationships to develop solutions to drive outstanding quality, effortless customer service and operational excellence. We are equally passionate about how our solutions benefit Allstate customers and claim professionals. By leveraging top talent from various quantitative disciplines, we collaborate with business partners and software engineers in development teams to create innovative products fueled by data science, artificial intelligence and industry insights.

Allstate’s goal is to use computer vision on photos/video and natural language processing of customer calls and sensor data from cars/homes to revolutionize how claims are handled. To go through this transformation, we require models that can extract meaning from the large amount of unstructured data customers supply us with for each claim. Below are a few examples of how we are using deep learning today:

NLP to predict who is at fault for an auto accident based on call recordings/transcripts of the accident. Knowing who is at fault allows for Allstate to pay our customers quickly.
Computer vision to identify the point of impact on a vehicle. Knowing the point of impact is critical for predicting if someone is injured in the vehicle or how much the vehicle is worth after the accident.
Computer vision to determine how to best repair damage to a vehicle.
NLP to extract information from a call. The question-and-answer pattern of our claim reporting system has many drop-down menus. This makes it easy to file a claim but isn’t always optimal for describing the nuances of each accident. By extracting extra meaning from the calls with NLP, we can get rich information out of the call for automation.

We are looking for someone who has deep expertise in computer vision or natural language processing who can take our deep learning to the next level.
Key Responsibilities

In this role, you will:
Identify new areas for deep learning that are not currently being worked on.
Research methods to improve modeling, including new techniques, data sources, and features.
Balance research of new techniques with execution and delivery of prioritized projects.
Work collaboratively and transparently with teammates to create a strong team culture.
Proactively support the team in ideation of how to approach a problem and reviewing results of model building.
Share modeling progress and results with our business partners to build excitement and enthusiasm for our work.
This role is for someone with lots of deep learning experience. This person will help expand the teams theoretical understanding of deep learning.

Supervisory Responsibilities:
This job has no supervisory duties. However, you will be expected to mentor junior data scientists on the team. Preferred Qualifications
PhD involving research in Computer Vision or Natural Language Processing
Preferred: 4+ years experience applying Computer Vision or Natural Language Processing to solve business problems. Compensation Data
The compensation range for this position is $147,000 and $190,000 per year, based on experience and qualifications.
The candidate(s) offered this position will be required to submit to a background investigation, which includes a drug screen.

Job Name: Data Scientist, Data Insights & Predictive Analytics - Ad Platforms
Job Description:
Summary
Posted: May 4, 2022
Weekly Hours: 40
Role Number:200369495
At Apple, we work every day to build products that enrich people’s lives. Our Advertising Platforms group makes it possible for people around the world to easily access informative and imaginative content on their devices while helping publishers and developers promote and monetize their work. Our technology and services power advertising in Apple News and Search Ads in the App Store. Our platforms are highly performant, deployed at scale, and set new standards for enabling effective advertising while protecting user privacy. The Ad Platforms Data Insights team is seeking a data scientist to join the Predictive Analytics Team in Austin, TX. The team is passionate about developing forward looking intelligence products for our marketplace. In this role you will work as a key member of a data-centric team to drive the exploration, analysis, development and execution of various solutions: revenue and opportunities forecasting models, understanding of user behavior and user engagement with our products, as well as finding ways of applying our findings and models through partnerships with other teams You will be tasked with discovering various patterns and trends in vast amounts of data and using these trends to advise business decisions. A successful candidate will have on-hands experience in various machine learning methods (particularly clustering and forecasting), ability to interpret results of analysis to drive business insights and forward looking decisions and ability to implement production-ready models. The role requires a broad knowledge of data mining algorithms, a strong eye for business, and creativity to invent and customize when needed. You’ll work directly with a broad range of data professionals and business leaders while using tools and methods to drive real-world business value. You will be a key player in a multi-functional team that delivers insights that have direct and measurable impact.
Key Qualifications
Hands on experience in quantitative analysis, including regression, classification, time-series, clustering. Ability to work with vast quantities of data.
Understanding of model development lifecycle from analysis and algorithm selection, to validation, and all the way to production implementation. Work efficiently with engineering partners on implementing your solutions.
Programming skills in Python and SQL.
Proficient with analytics tools such as R, Spark, and Tableau.
Ability to communicate the results of analyses in a clear and effective manner to influence the overall strategy of the product.
Experience in a data science role - preferably in digital advertising.
Description
- Support Executive team, Product, Marketing, and Partner. Development/Sales team by developing progressive view of product performance. - Become an authority on both the business and the data to drive new insights. - Develop variety of scalable predictive solutions and engage with other teams on facilitating usage of these models. Implement these solutions in production environment.
Education & Experience
Masters or Bachelors degree in a quantitative field of study including statistics, math, economics, operations research or a related field.
Additional Requirements
Apple’s most important resource, our soul, is our people. Apple benefits help further the well-being of our employees and their families in meaningful ways. No matter where you work at Apple, you can take advantage of our health and wellness resources and time-away programs. We’re proud to provide stock grants to employees at all levels of the company, and we also give employees the option to buy Apple stock at a discount — both offer everyone at Apple the chance to share in the company’s success. You’ll discover many more benefits of working at Apple, such as programs that match your charitable contributions, reimburse you for continuing your education and give you special employee pricing on Apple products.
Apple benefits programs vary by country and are subject to eligibility requirements.
Apple is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We take affirmative action to ensure equal opportunity for all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, Veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics. Apple is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to applicants with physical and mental disabilities. Apple is a drug-free workplace.

Who Are We?

Taking care of our customers, our communities and each other. That's the Travelers Promise. By honoring this commitment, we have maintained our reputation as one of the best property casualty insurers in the industry for over 160 years. Join us to discover a culture that is rooted in innovation and thrives on collaboration. Imagine loving what you do and where you do it.

Job Category

Analytics & Research

Compensation Overview

The annual base salary range provided for this position is a nationwide market range and represents a broad range of salaries for this role across the country. The actual salary for this position will be determined by a number of factors, including the scope, complexity and location of the role; the skills, education, training, credentials and experience of the candidate; and other conditions of employment. As part of our comprehensive compensation and benefits program, employees are also eligible for performance-based cash incentive awards.

Salary Range
$110,600.00 - $182,600.00

Target Openings

1

What Is the Opportunity?

Travelers Data Scientists are taking the organization to the next level of intelligence by using advanced statistical techniques and machine learning algorithms. As a Data Scientist, you will work with business partners to tell the story using data by identifying challenges and opportunities for data analysis and experiments. You will build models that solve key business challenges and enhance our customer experience.
Primary Job Duties & Responsibilities
Assist in design and development of analytical solutions.
Share knowledge with the community through discussions, presentations, or peer reviews.
Begin to set and manage expectations with business partners for small projects, and with guidance, identify potential conflicts and build consensus.
Communicate analysis, insights, and results to manager, peers and business partners and with guidance, tailor communication to the audience.
Become a mentor or resource for less experienced analytic talent, onboard new employees and interns, and provide support for intern recruiting and talent assessment efforts.
Support various training and skill development initiatives
Minimum Qualifications
Master's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Decision Sciences, Actuarial Science or related analytical STEM field plus two years of experience or any suitable and equivalent combination of education and work experience.
Heavy concentration in mathematics, including statistics and programming, business intelligence/analytics, as well as data science tools and research using large data sets. Additional verification of specific coursework will be required.

Education, Work Experience, & Knowledge
Masters in STEM related field or equivalent
3 years of related experience
Strong working knowledge of modeling/ research/analytics or actuarial required
Relevant statistical analysis work experience required
Strong Knowledge of statistical techniques with the ability to read/revise/ review statistical software programs
Ability to develop models and interpret model results
Understanding of advanced statistics underlying data models
Ability to apply emerging statistical procedures to work
Strong knowledge in: Regression, Classification, Machine Vision, Natural Language Processing, Deep Learning and Statistical modeling.

Employment Practices

Travelers is an equal opportunity employer. We value the unique abilities and talents each individual brings to our organization and recognize that we benefit in numerous ways from our differences.

If you are a candidate and have specific questions regarding the physical requirements of this role, please send us an email so we may assist you.

Travelers reserves the right to fill this position at a level above or below the level included in this posting.

To learn more about our comprehensive benefit programs please visit http://careers.travelers.com/life-at-travelers/benefits/.

Data Scientist - Statistics
New York City, New York
$140,000 - $160,000 base salary + equity
Harnham are partnered with one of the most exciting medical technology startups in New York. They are at an exciting point in their growth as they are looking to scale up their data science team. This position reports into the Director of Data Science having a high-level of visibility and calls for an experienced candidate with a strong statistical background within data science and machine learning.
THE ROLE
As the Data Scientist, you will be required to:
Use advanced statistical methodologies to analyze various datasets, build new products and evolve existing models
Work closely with junior members, helping to mentor
Own new projects answering challenging medical questions and developing predictive models
Provide deep technical knowledge within machine learning and statistics
Write code for proof-of-concept and production-grade projects and communicate with the entire technical team to impact algorithm production
YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
The successful Data Scientist will likely have the following skills and experience:
MS or PhD in Statistics, Computer Science or quantitative field (STEM)
History of research application of Bayesian Statistics, Monte Carlo, causal inference or similar
Strong experience developing and implementing statistical algorithms in a commercial setting
Experienced in statistical machine learning
Programming experience in Python preferred or R

Knowledge of Big Data packages a plus, Hadoop, Spark, Hive or others
Proven communicator with technical teams, clients and senior stakeholders
Comfortable working both collaboratively and independently
THE BENEFITS
A competitive base salary of $140,000 - $160,000 + equity
HOW TO APPLY
Please register your interest by sending your résumé to Tim Jonas via the Apply link on this page.
KEYWORDS
Machine Learning | Statistics | Medical | Healthcare | Data Science | Startup | Causal Inference | Technology

Job Name: Lead Data Scientist - Supply Chain Optimization (REMOTE or HQ)
Job Description:
Location: 7000 Target Pkwy N, Brooklyn Park, Minnesota, United States, 55445
JOIN TARGET AS LEAD DATA SCIENTIST – SUPPLY CHAIN OPTIMIZATION
Join the Target’s Data Sciences team where we develop discrete event simulations of our global supply chain. Our mission is to leverage operations research, simulation, and machine learning to help Target makes intelligent supply chain business decisions at scale. This involves writing high-performant, scalable code as well as designing analytical solutions to extract insights and to prescribe best courses of action.
You’ll work in an environment that provides the freedom and agility of a startup - with the security and vast resources of a large established company with continuous learning opportunities provided. Our team aims to be inclusive, collaborative, highly motivated, smart, and humble!
In this role at Target as a Lead Data Scientist, you will:
Work closely with partner team data scientists to review and iterate on optimization and machine learning algorithms and develop state of the art mathematical models
Work with engineers to design, deploy and productize models at scale. Our models run many times a day for millions of combinations of stock keeping units and distribution networks
Work with business partners to learn about the retail business and processes in play
Ideate and resolve tradeoffs between model granularity and features as well as performance, reliability, and usability of our codebase. Improve engineering standards, tooling, and processes
Mentor and develop other data scientists and Ai engineers.
What we're looking for:
You have a strong knowledge of supply chain optimization – inventory, transportation, sourcing, distribution, fulfillment, planning…
You have a real passion and the technical skills for helping Target make data-informed decisions.
You possess strong computer science fundamentals and love rock-solid, well-structured, and efficient code: data structures, algorithms, programming languages, and information retrieval.
You write understandable, testable code with an eye towards maintainability.
A passion for empirical research and answering hard questions with large scale data
You are a strong communicator. Explaining complex technical concepts to the business and other data scientists/engineers is no problem for you.
You understand that simplicity is hard but key to achieving maintainability and to being able to continually deliver value to the business.
You have usability and convenience for business users in mind.
Requirements:
M.S in Computer Science, Math, Statistics, Operations Research, Industrial Engineering, or related quantitative fields
5+ years of professional experience writing modular and highly performant code and deploying algorithms in a production environment
Proficient in predictive and prescriptive algorithms
Proficient in one or more programming languages: Python, Java, Kotlin or C
Strong engineering mindset and exposure to software engineering principles, Agile, data pipeline engineering, distributed systems, and machine learning at scale
Experience leading large-scale implementations of optimization, simulation, machine learning and deep learning models
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Preferred Requirements:
PhD degree or equivalent experience
Proficient in application/software architecture (definition, business process modeling, etc.)
Experience writing production datasets in SQL/Hive or building internal/production data tools for research or experimentation in a scripting language like Python
Why work with us at Target Data Sciences?
We Care, Grown and Win Together!
You’ll work directly on the problems that have the most impact on Target's entire Recommendations/Personalization strategy for all Digital/Target.com products.
We love open-source! Many of our team members contribute to open source communities and get to do it during work time. We try to contribute back to our communities where we can and are grateful to be able to open source some of our own projects
We value diversity! We believe that diversity and inclusion are core importance when creating positive experiences for our guests and we think it’s critically important when building our teams
We value our team members! We treat our team members like people, not like cogs in a machine. We value our team members for who they are, not just what they can get done. We are parents, hobbyists, enthusiasts, travelers, family members, community members and can offer flexibility to our team members' schedules/work arrangements so they can flourish both in and outside of work
Career development and our ’50 days of Learning’ mantra allow team member to learn from experts, publish, work on patents, grow new skillset as well as mentoring/volunteering
This position may be considered for a Full-Time Remote or Hybrid work arrangement based on Target’s needs. A Hybrid work arrangement means the team members core role will be a blend of virtual and onsite at a Target location. A Full-Time Remote work arrangement means the team member works full-time from home or an alternate location that’s not a Target location, does not have a desk at their primary HQ work location and may travel to HQ up to 4 times yr.
Colorado, Connecticut or Nevada Residents Only: The salary range for Colorado, Connecticut or Nevada residents is $106,000 to $190,000. Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, etc. In addition to your salary, Target cares about and invests in you as a team member, so that you can take care of yourself and your family. Find competitive benefits from financial and education to well-being and beyond.
Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA)
Target will provide reasonable accommodations (such as a qualified sign language interpreter or other personal assistance) with the application process upon your request as required to comply with applicable laws. If you have a disability and require assistance in this application process, please visit your nearest Target store or Distribution Center or reach out to Guest Services at 1-800-440-0680 for additional information.

The physical location of this position will be in McLean, VA.
Are you passionate about the chance to bring your data quality improvement experience to a world class organization that is leading the way in both content and technology to serve and protect our citizens home and abroad? Do you have the skills necessary to manage, understand, and analyze in-house and customer data including text mining, developing predictive systems, risk scoring, creating efficient algorithms, data quality improvement and other related activities? Then Thomson Reuters Special Services (TRSS) is looking for you!
What You’ll Do: As a Data Scientist, you will be responsible for driving, identify, evaluate, design and implement statistical analyses of gathered open source, proprietary, and customer data to create analytic metrics and tools to support TRSS analysts, customers and existing product offerings. Successful candidates will have the opportunity to contribute directly to the features and capabilities deployed in our applications. They will work with customers to assist in gathering requirements and contributing to Statements of Work (SOWs) for new sales or POCs, and executing design post sale while getting deeply involved into the delivery of the proposed solutions. The role will interface with the customer and provide continuity of technical and data-exploration expertise to ensure we are delivering a workable solution that meets the customer requirements and technical capabilities. The position requires a proactive, mission-oriented person who strives to produce the best possible work for the customer.
As the Data Scientist, you will also contribute to a variety of areas including:
Working with interdisciplinary engineering and research teams on designing, building and deploying data analysis systems for large data sets.
Working closely with customers to apply data science to their mission specific content.
Creating algorithms to extract information from large data sets.
Establishment of scalable, efficient, automated processes for model development, model validation, model implementation, and large-scale data analysis.
Development of metrics and prototypes that can be used to drive business decisions.
Providing thought-leadership and dependable execution on diverse projects.
Identification of emergent trends and opportunities for future client growth and development.
Researching and identifying Artificial Intelligence (AI) methods – including Machine Learning (ML) and Natural Language Processing (NLP) methods.
Identification of new applications of AI in the context of Thomson Reuters and TRSS content sets.
Exploring existing data for insights, and recommends additional sources of data for improvement.
About You:
You’re a good fit for the role of Data Scientist if you have:
A minimum of DHS granted public trust suitablity, DOD Secret or Top Secret required.
A Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field (e.g., statistics, computer science, mathematics, physical/biological sciences, or GIS).
Three years of experience with data cleaning, analysis, programming, and reporting of results to internal or external stakeholders.
Programming skills in one major programming language (Python/R/Java).
Are creative, intellectually curious, and willing to experiment and work in dynamic organizations and situations, sometimes with little oversight or well-defined requirements.
The ability to take ownership for defined areas of accountability, most critically the integrity of the technical and data design in terms of meeting customer needs, design delivery and supportability.
A good understanding of distributed computing concepts.
Experience facilitating and gathering input from subject matter experts.
Excellent understanding of ML, NLP, and statistical methodologies.
The ability to test ideas and adapt methods quickly end to end from data extraction to implementation and validation.
Strong planning, time management, and organizational skills.
A team player / self-starter mentality with the ability to work using own initiative.
Ability to obtain and maintain a U.S. national security clearance.
Additional Desired Skills:
Big Data analytics experience (preferred, but not required).
Previous experience with data modeling for graphs (preferred, but not required).
Experience with search engines, classification algorithms, recommendation systems, and relevance evaluation methodologies (preferred, but not required).
What’s in it For You?
At Thomson Reuters Special Services, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:
Our Culture: Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more
Wellbeing: Comprehensive benefit plans; company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing
Learning & Development: Environment that encourages continuous learning and development
Social Impact: Six employee-driven Employee Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact
Compensation: Competitive salary and bonus component with market-leading benefits
Do you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? How about a team that works every day to create a more transparent, just and inclusive future? At Thomson Reuters, we’ve been doing just that for almost 160 years. Our industry-leading products and services include highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for legal, tax, accounting and compliance professionals combined with the world’s most global news services – Reuters. We help these professionals do their jobs better, creating more time for them to focus on the things that matter most: advising, advocating, negotiating, governing and informing.
We are powered by the talents of 25,000 employees across more than 75 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in flexible work environments that celebrate diversity and inclusion. At a time when objectivity, accuracy, fairness and transparency are under attack, we consider it our duty to pursue them. Sound exciting? Join us and help shape the industries that move society forward.
Accessibility
As a global business, we rely on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under applicable law. Thomson Reuters is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer providing a drug-free workplace.
We also make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and for sincerely held religious beliefs in accordance with applicable law.

Job Name: Junior Data Scientist - Experimental Design (Remote - Home Based Worker)
Job Description:
The world isn’t standing still, and neither is Allstate. We’re moving quickly, looking across our businesses and brands and taking bold steps to better serve customers’ evolving needs. That’s why now is an exciting time to join our team. You’ll have opportunities to take risks, challenge the status quo and shape the future for the greater good.

You’ll do all this in an environment of excellence and the highest ethical standards – a place where values such as integrity, inclusive diversity and accountability are paramount. We empower every employee to lead, drive change and give back where they work and live. Our people are our greatest strength, and we work as one team in service of our customers and communities.

Everything we do at Allstate is driven by a shared purpose: to protect people from life’s uncertainties so they can realize their hopes and dreams. For more than 89 years we’ve thrived by staying a step ahead of whatever’s coming next – to give customers peace of mind no matter what changes they face. We acted with conviction to advocate for seat belts, air bags and graduated driving laws. We help give survivors of domestic violence a voice through financial empowerment. We’ve been an industry leader in pricing sophistication, telematics, digital photo claims and, more recently, device and identity protection. We are the Good Hands. We don’t follow the trends. We set them. Department Summary:
Data, Discovery, and Decision Science (D3) is the research and analytics organization at Allstate. In D3, you’ll be surrounded by 360+ tenacious and intellectually curious colleagues in an inclusive culture that encourages you to take risks, challenge the status quo and shape the future for the greater good. We are solving some of today’s most complicated analytics problems, making the lives of our Allstate colleagues easier and more productive, and driving our mission to deliver targeted insurance solutions to our customers. We are partnering to incorporate analytics into every aspect of the enterprise. We are avid about learning new ways to get the most value from our massive data resources and leading-edge technology. We are committed to building an inclusive and diverse team where everyone has an equal opportunity to succeed. We strive to hire people from different backgrounds so that we can better serve our diverse customer needs. Job Summary:
In this role, you will serve as a consultant in the design and analysis of experiments with partners across the enterprise. You will collaborate as part of cross-functional teams on a wide variety of strategic initiatives and your contributions will inform learning and evidence-based decision making within these programs. You will be responsible for advising throughout the lifecycle of a program and supporting success through technical execution (i.e. evaluating potential design approaches, sample size and test duration calculations) and analysis (communication of results and messaging of statistical concepts to influence action).

This role is posted at the junior, entry level; however, D3 hiring leadership has flexibility to hire at a more senior level if your background includes directly-applicable years of experience and competencies. For this reason, we'd invite both entry-level and experienced Data Scientists to apply. Key Responsibilities:
Uses best practices, with coaching, to develop statistical and machine learning techniques to build experimental designs and models that address business needs and enable test and learn competency.
Understands business problems and constraints to identify the optimal learning approach.
Communicates to team members, leadership and stakeholders on findings to ensure test results are well understood and incorporated into business processes.
Collaborates with the team on data and business problems to drive improved business results through designing, building, and partnering to implement tests and analytic solutions.
Innovates on projects by using new techniques or tools Qualifications:
Education and Experience
Master’s or PhD
2 or more years of related experience (To be considered for the more senior-level version of this role)

Functional Skills
Experience in using statistical modeling and/or test & learn techniques to design solutions that have informed and influenced company decision making
Ability to provide written and oral interpretation of highly specialized terms and data, and ability to present this data to others with different levels of expertise
Demonstrated Analytic Agility and ability to quickly learn and switch topics
Ability to use and learn a wide variety of tools and languages to achieve results
Ability to code and develop prototypes in various languages
Ability to analyze and interpret moderate concepts (especially in the context of statistics and design of experiments)

Compensation offered for this role is $80,000 - $94,000 and is based on experience and qualifications.

The candidate(s) offered this position will be required to submit to a background investigation, which includes a drug screen.

Good Work. Good Life. Good Hands®.

As a Fortune 100 company and industry leader, we provide a competitive salary – but that’s just the beginning. Our Total Rewards package also offers benefits like tuition assistance, medical and dental insurance, as well as a robust pension and 401(k). Plus, you’ll have access to a wide variety of programs to help you balance your work and personal life -- including a generous paid time off policy. For a full description of Allstate’s benefits, visit allstate.jobs/benefits/

Learn more about life at Allstate. Connect with us on Twitter , Facebook , Instagram and LinkedIn or watch a video .
